intro: Hieracium albogilvum, commonly known as the white-veined hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with white veins. Hieracium albogilvum is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
